meanings.definition: The quality or state of being manly or masculine.
meanings.sent1: His mandom was evident in the way he carried himself with confidence.
meanings.sent2: The warrior's mandom shone through as he fearlessly faced his enemies.
meanings.sent3: Even in a pink apron, his mandom was undeniable.
meanings.sent4: His mandom was a beacon of strength in a sea of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The mandom of the lumberjack was as sturdy as the oak trees he felled.

meanings.definition: A group or society of men, especially one with shared interests or goals.
meanings.sent1: The mandom gathered every Friday night for poker games.
meanings.sent2: In the mandom of firefighters, camaraderie was paramount.
meanings.sent3: The mandom of book club enthusiasts met to discuss their latest read.
meanings.sent4: The mandom of hikers conquered the mountain together.
meanings.sent5: The mandom of fishermen swapped stories by the lake.

meanings.definition: To behave in a manly or courageous manner.
meanings.sent1: He decided to mandom up and face his fears head-on.
meanings.sent2: She had to mandom through the difficult situation with grace.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mandom his way out of the tough conversation.
meanings.sent4: In the face of danger, he knew he had to mandom bravely.
meanings.sent5: The knight had to mandom his way through the dragon's lair.
